instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Not sure if I can get some direction on this I replaced a screen on my laptop without disabling the autoboot now my laptop won’t power on. I have read in some forums some people having the same issue but they could power on without having the battery connected my laptop will not power on with battery connected or if battery is disconnected. I was going to attempt to find a short on the logic board so I purchased a usb-c volt and amp reader and it appears as if I’m getting normal power to the laptop 20v’s and amps vary. So I’m thinking I’m not seeing a short in the logic board could it be that I may have a defective power button? I’m not sure any thoughts on what I should try next?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Didn't disconect the battery, when swapped the screen?

Check for voltage on all coils.
Post the exact 820-xxxx code of your board.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Yes battery was disconnected when I installed the screen. I removed that pancake screw and unplugged the battery only thing I didn't do was disable autoboot which everyone says you have to do. I haven't removed the board yet but should be the #<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 051-00515 (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 3163).

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 73171, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Didn't disconect the battery, when swapped the screen?

Check for voltage on all coils.
Post the exact 820-xxxx code of your board.
[/QUOTE]

Sorry I am a complete noob to troubleshooting these macbook computers. Because it involves more work on the mother board I don't have any experience besides what I watch on youtube.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Did you check for USB activity and external video?
Caps Lock light reacts?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: No unit does not power on at all, the fans to not start up so nothing on keyboard is lighting up. I thought maybe the screen was the issue so I reinstalled the old screen and the computer still does not power on.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Something happened in the replace process.
Check for knocked off components..
Is better to find a serious service shop and go there.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: At this point its more of a figure out project. I'll take it apart and see what I can find what should the amperage be roughly? I bought the usb-c amp reader and get 20v's but amperage is kind of all over. I'll take it apart and see if anything stands out.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
You will need to check voltages in several points, as all big coils first.
Need to identify the board (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>/875 matbe) and get schematic/boardview.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Ok model of board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A I'm looking around to see if I can find a schematic for this. Once removed from case I still get 20V and about .37 amps when plugged in.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Check this.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1C-xBnPpb-5dS4wQ-x82Zph3cPhGfqTYj/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Perfect thanks which coils should I test?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
All big coils.; some of them (iGPU) will not have voltage as normal.
We need your voltage readings to see how to continue.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Ok man I've had to watch a few videos before I attempted this but I hope it makes sense so I tested a whole bunch of coils with the majority coming out with 0 v. There is a coil L7030 that is the biggest on I could find on this board and I am getting a reading of 13v's on both pin 1 and 2. At one point after about 10 mins the amps dropped significantly to about .02-.04 and that same coil L7030 was only getting 3V's on both pins.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Ok just to confirm after 5mins the amps drop to 0.02a so there definitely is an issue I'm thinking.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
You should check if always get 13V at F7000, not L7030.
But we need voltages from other coils; like L7600/60.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Ok first man thanks for your patience I have tested F7000 I am getting 13V and I also tested L7600 I am getting 5v and L7660 is getting 3V.
I also followed through the chain followed <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHAGR_REG</SIGNAL> path and found <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7051</CAPACITOR> and 13v was present at both of these locations. Any other locations you'd like me to check out?

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
L7410/20/30 don't have voltage as normal, check all other coils.
Also see which voltage remains when the current drops to 0.02A.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Ok here's the info:
L7410 - goes up to 0.16v but then goes back to 0
L7420 - 0v
L7430- 0v
L7210 - 0.46v
L7220 - 0.48v
L7700 - 1v
L7900 - 1v
L8000 - 1v
L8050 - 1v
L9400 - 2.7v
L3500 -   -0.03v to 0.03v
L8410 - 0v

When amps drop I test all the coils and voltage is unchanged so the F7000 stays at 13v's.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
I adverted you, do NOT check L7410/20/30.

L7210/20 voltage could be good, but should b3e compared with good working board.
Do you note this voltage droping from 1V in few seconds?

You've forgot L8020.
Don't you get 1.2V at L7900?
ALWAYS check DC voltage at output pin of a coil.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: Ok L7210/20 jump anywhere from 0.15 - 0.51 only if amps are sitting between 0.11a - 0.25a. When I first plug in the motherboard amps jump up to 0.83a and the volts range on those 2 coils from 0.46 - 1v. L7900 measured at 1.2v. L8020 measured 0volts and now my amp meter only reads 0.02-0.04a any time it is plugged in. It does not jump up to 0.83a anymore it consistently measuring 0.02 - 0.04a.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
Leave the battery disconnected.
The board should turn on automatically, when charger is connected.
If not, press power button.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: When I was testing the coils I had already removed the LB from the case so the battery has not been connected. I did have the charger plugged in when testing the coils but something definitely happened because amps are now only running at 0.02 to 0.04a.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message:
I don't recommend you to spend more time with this board.
You did something wrong when swapped the screen panel.
Do not insist, as seems you already made more damage after that.

I hope you don't take this as an offense.
Just need someone with more experience to try and recover it (if still possible).

threads.title: MacBook Pro 2017 13" will not turn on after screen replaced?
threads.message: No offense taken. I appreciate your time.
